{"step_by_step_thinking": "Port wine stains are a type of birthmark that are caused by abnormal development of blood vessels (capillaries). They are not associated with nevus, which is a type of mole or skin blemish. They are also not associated with melanoma, which is a type of skin cancer. However, they are a type of vascular birthmark, which is also known as a haemangioma.", "answer_choice": "B"}
